subject: Re: Hi, We've recorded your migration request! Our support team will ge...
preview: Re: Hi, We've recorded your migration request! Our support team will ge...

full_threads.body: Re: Hi, We've recorded your migration request! Our support team will ge...

We haven't heard back from you on this topic in a while so we're going to go ahead and close this conversation.

However, if you do need further assistance you can simply reply and the conversation will be reopened or you can start a new conversation.

Let us know if you need further assistance!

--

https://static.intercomassets.com/avatars/64049/square_128/doug_profil-1485941361.jpg?1485941361 Peter from Kinsta

On Fri, Aug 24, 2018 at 08:50 PM, "Peter Sziraki" <peter.sziraki@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Hi,

Were you able to check this issue with the theme? I see that the live site is loading perfectly now.

Thanks,
Peter

On Fri, Aug 24, 2018 at 12:11 AM, "Peter Sziraki" <peter.sziraki@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Can you log in and disable the image loading? Because it's a theme specific function I'm not sure if we can bypass it in any way.

On Fri, Aug 24, 2018 at 12:06 AM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Thanks Peter. With the issue you mention, do you know a work around for this?

On Thu, Aug 23, 2018 at 11:58 PM, "Peter Sziraki" <peter.sziraki@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

The migration has been finished. Since the site's current SSL certificate could not be migrated, you can test the site by reviewing the staging site:

https://staging-kissgoodbyetoms.kinsta.com/

I see an issue there, within your theme:
Uncaught TypeError: $(...).imagesLoaded is not a function
at isotope_post (ajax-ambassador.js:80)
at ajax-ambassador.js:4
at dispatch (jquery.js:3)
at r.handle (jquery.js:3)

This is the file in question: wp-content/themes/kissgoodbye/kgb/assets/js/ajax-ambassador.js

The site has been switched to PHP7.2 and I've uploaded our Kinsta Cache plugin. You can clear our server side caching from there.

Keep in mind, that because the SSL from the prior server was not available to install on our infrastructure, using the live URL the site will not load properly from our servers right now. Once the DNS changes propagate, you may generate a new Let's Encrypt SSL from the Tools tab in MyKinsta. Once the new SSL has been generated, the site will begin to load properly over https.

Please do not try to generate the Let's Encrypt SSL prior to DNS propagation because Let's Encrypt only allows a limited number of requests per hour. Trying multiple times to generate the SSL before DNS propagation has completed may result in a delay in the generation of the SSL.

If you are unsure about when to generate the Let's Encrypt SSL, please get in touch with our Support team and we will be glad to assist you.

We have a small list of plugins that are disallowed on our infrastructure, please take a look at it.

https://kinsta.com/knowledgebase/disallowed-plugins/

I've moved some unnecessary files and disallowed plugins to the 'old' folder.

Please test everything and let us know if you need any help. If you update anything on the old server (before making the DNS change), the changes will be lost.

If you think your site is ready, please point your domain's A record to 35.189.58.105 . Our guide at https://kinsta.com/knowledgebase/dns/ goes over the process of updating your dns. (If your site is behind Cloudflare you’ll have to update the A record there). Also, please remove the AAAA record, if you have one.

On Thu, Aug 23, 2018 at 11:36 PM, "Peter Sziraki" <peter.sziraki@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Thanks.

On Thu, Aug 23, 2018 at 11:35 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

kissgoodbyetoms.org/wp-login.php

On Thu, Aug 23, 2018 at 11:32 PM, "Peter Sziraki" <peter.sziraki@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

I can continue the migration without the maintenance mode, just let me know.

On Thu, Aug 23, 2018 at 11:16 PM, "Peter Sziraki" <peter.sziraki@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

I'm unable to log in to the wp-admin dashboard to set up the maintenance mode, please provide the login URL.

On Thu, Aug 23, 2018 at 11:03 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Got, thanks Peter!

On Thu, Aug 23, 2018 at 11:03 PM, "Peter Sziraki" <peter.sziraki@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Hi,

We'll start the transfer soon. Please stop updating your site if possible until we finish the process.
We'll keep you updated.

Cheers,
Peter

On Thu, Aug 23, 2018 at 05:01 PM, "Dan G." <dan.g@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

No problem. :)

On Thu, Aug 23, 2018 at 05:01 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Awesome thanks!

On Thu, Aug 23, 2018 at 05:01 PM, "Dan G." <dan.g@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Hello,

Sure, I have updated that to 11PM for you. :)

On Thu, Aug 23, 2018 at 04:47 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Hi Dan, can we please push this back to 11pm at all?

On Thu, Aug 23, 2018 at 03:39 PM, "Dan G." <dan.g@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Ok will do with maintenance mode. If you have any questions in the meantime feel free to let us know here.

On Thu, Aug 23, 2018 at 03:38 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Yep, that's fine thanks Dan.

That site will need to go into maintenance mode please.

On Thu, Aug 23, 2018 at 03:38 PM, "Dan G." <dan.g@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

So we don't have an open space until 10PM. Is that ok?

On Thu, Aug 23, 2018 at 03:36 PM, "Dan G." <dan.g@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Ok, I will schedule kissgoodbyetoms.org for today 9:30PM AEST.

On Thu, Aug 23, 2018 at 03:34 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Then can we schedule the kissgoodbyetoms.org one for around 9:30pm?

On Thu, Aug 23, 2018 at 03:34 PM, "Dan G." <dan.g@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Ok, will start working on that one now then.

On Thu, Aug 23, 2018 at 03:33 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Can you please do the finland.wpperk.com one first. No need to put it into maintenance mode.

On Thu, Aug 23, 2018 at 03:32 PM, "Dan G." <dan.g@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Ok that's working, when trying /wp-admin it redirects back to the homepage.

So since you have two sites for migration, do either of these need to be put into maintenance mode during the process? If so which site do you want to move first?

On Thu, Aug 23, 2018 at 03:17 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Hi Dan, is this for the kissgoodbyetoms.org site? If so, can you please try kissgoodbyetoms.org/wp-login.php

On Thu, Aug 23, 2018 at 03:11 PM, "Dan G." <dan.g@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Hello,

Thanks for your migration request.

I have reviewed the preliminary details and all seems to be in order except the WordPress Admin URL seems to be hidden. Please provide that admin URL so we can test the site post-migration.

The next step is to get the migration scheduled. Were you looking to have this migration done as soon as possible, or would you like to schedule it during a certain time frame? If you would like to schedule it, please provide us with a date, time, and your local timezone so that we can check our migration calendar to see if we can accommodate.

We are standing by for your update.

On Thu, Aug 23, 2018 at 02:11 PM, "Anita Dunai" <anita.dunai@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Hi,

We've recorded your migration request! Our support team will get in touch with you soon to schedule the transferring of your site.

Once our support team proposes a time for the migration we will ask you to confirm the migration schedule. It is important that you be watching for this message and confirm the scheduled migration time as soon as possible.

If you are unable to confirm a migration time with our support team within 7 days of the original request, the migration request will be canceled, credited to your account, and will need to be resubmitted when you are ready to confirm the scheduling of the migration.

Cheers,
Anita
